text: Then the king sent a captain of fifty with his fifty to him. He went up to him; and behold,1:9 “Behold”, from “הִנֵּה”, means look at, take notice, observe, see, or gaze at. It is often used as an interjection. he was sitting on the top of the hill. He said to him, “Man of God, the king has said, ‘Come down!’”
